page.title: 11TO-DAY'S STREET TECHNOLOGY
page.content: The new thing in the high street is an electronic bank door opener which enables you to enter the bank out of hours.You slip a card into the computerised I.D.system to make sure you aren't an intruder,so you don't have to stand in the rain.You don't go into the till area,just an auto bank which uses the same kind of card. The new communications technology is a telephone card.A phone card is inserted into a slot in the telephone and each unit on the card is worth 10 pence.There are 40-100 units on a card.Anyone can buy a telephone card from a newsagent with a special booth outside. These are some examples of today's street technology.
